abstract: Post and Courier newspaper in Charleston, SC, has delivered coverage of shooting at Emanuel African Methodist Episcopal Church with mixture of journalistic diligence and sensitivity to residents; is latest paper to show that journalists familiar with communities where tragedies occur are uniquely qualified to cover events that arise in their aftermath.
lead_paragraph: The Post and Courier had a national tragedy occur on its doorstep. And its journalists are using their intimate familiarity with the community to provide distinctive coverage.

headline.main: At Charleston Newspaper, Covering the News, and Choking Back Tears
headline.print_headline: A Community’s Pain Reported, and Felt
